name: Primeval History
description: From Creation through the Flood and Tower of Babel to the call of Abraham. Covers Genesis 1-11.

name: Dates Unknown
description: Creation, Fall, Flood, Tower of Babel

name: Patriarchal Period
description: The era of Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and Joseph. God establishes His covenant with Abraham and his descendants.

name: Egyptian Sojourn
description: Israel's time in Egypt, from Jacob's family settling in Goshen through their enslavement and eventual deliverance.

name: Wilderness
description: Israel wandered 40 years in the wilderness due to unbelief. God provided manna, water, and the Law while preparing a new generation to enter the Promised Land.

name: Era of the Judges
description: Israel repeatedly fell into idolatry, oppression, repentance, and deliverance through judges (military leaders/prophets). This cycle lasted about 350 years.

name: Kingdom Divides
description: The kingdom split into Israel (north, 10 tribes) and Judah (south, 2 tribes). Ended with the fall of both kingdoms.

name: Babylonian Exile
description: The 70-year period of Judah's captivity in Babylon following the destruction of Jerusalem and the Temple.

name: Restoration Period
description: The return from exile, rebuilding of the Temple and Jerusalem's walls under Zerubbabel, Ezra, and Nehemiah.
